data.title: Man admits killing, eating dog
data.description: A man in Chiang Rai was arrested for animal cruelty after killing a dog he recently adopted for its meat.

data.title: Govt aims for 25% drop in hotspots
data.description: The government aims to reduce hotspots by 25% this dry season compared to last year to mitigate air pollution, according to Deputy Prime Minister and Digital Economy and Society Minister Prasert Jantararuangtong.

data.title: Government to ramp up student swaps
data.description: The Ministry of Higher Education, Science, Research and Innovation (MHESI) aims to increase student exchanges with Italian universities in the areas of medical technology innovation and energy science.

data.title: Several decisions to make
data.description: National politics has been gripped by three major issues, two of which are interconnected and could be doomed to failure.

data.title: Cocoa added to special watchlist
data.description: The committee on agriculture and cooperatives policy and development has added cocoa to the list of crops under the supervision of a sub-committee on horticultural crops.

data.title: Minimum wage to 'hit B400 as NY gift'
data.description: The Labour Ministry aims to increase the daily wage to 400 baht nationwide on Jan 1 as a New Year

data.title: Phumtham urges DTI to spearhead defence industry
data.description: Defence Minister Phumtham Wechayachai yesterday urged the Defence Technology Institute (DTI) to link up with the armed forces and the private sector in developing the country

data.title: Parliament complex almost done
data.description: The new parliament will be fully operational next month with more than 1,000 security cameras in place to ensure tight security, according to House Speaker Wan Muhammad Noor Matha.

data.title: Govt to ramp up student swaps
data.description: The Ministry of Higher Education, Science, Research and Innovation (MHESI) aims to increase student exchanges with Italian universities in the areas of medical technology innovation and energy science.

data.title: Govt to okay JTC for Cambodia talks
data.description: The government is expected to approve the establishment of the Joint Technical Committee (JTC) to negotiate with Cambodia over the development of disputed maritime areas in the Gulf of Thailand during a cabinet meeting on Tuesday.

data.title: Thaksin's S112 remarks are 'untrue'
data.description: Progressive Movement leader Thanathorn Juangroongruangkit has rebutted former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra

data.title: PM signals tech commitment
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra has assured global tech giants that the Thai government is committed to promoting digital skills and infrastructure and collaborating with them in these areas.

data.title: 11 hurt as school van overturns in Surat Thani
data.description: SURAT THANI: Nine students and two teachers returning from a camping activity were injured when their van overturned in Kanchanadit district of this southern province on Friday afternoon.

data.title: AI to help raise access to quality education
data.description: BURI RAM - The Ministry of Education is calling on schools nationwide to improve the quality of their teaching to align with the latest technology including  artificial intelligence , according to Deputy Education Minister Surasak Phancharoenworakul.

data.title: 2 students killed, 12 hurt as truck hits school pickup
data.description: PATTANI: Two students were killed and 12 others hurt, one badly, when a six-wheel truck hit a parked pickup carrying students in Sai Buri district of this southern province on Friday.

data.title: Veterinarian ‘didn’t knock out TV cat’
data.description: The person who anaesthetised a black  cat  in the TV drama  The Empress of Ayodhaya , also known as Mae Yua, was not a veterinarian but someone from the agency that provided the animal, according to the Department of Livestock Development.

data.title: Thunderstorms to blanket Greater Bangkok as rain refuses to let up
data.description: Rain is predicted in Bangkok and its vicinity until Monday, according to the Meteorological Department.

data.title: Thai soldiers ‘tortured and killed Myanmar migrant’, rights group says
data.description: A human rights group has called on Thai authorities to fully investigate three soldiers for the “horrific” death of a Myanmar migrant on the border in Tak province earlier this year, saying they had tortured and beaten the man.

data.title: EC explains new Provincial Administrative Organisations poll date
data.description: The election of chairs and members of Provincial Administrative Organisations (PAOs) will be held on Saturday, Feb 1, instead of Sunday, Feb 2, in a bid to ensure the vote runs smoothly given the legal limitations outlined in the election law, EC commissioner Santhat Siriananpaiboon says.

data.title: State Railway of Thailand defies Department of Lands in Buri Ram dispute
data.description: The State Railway of Thailand (SRT) has appealed the Department of Lands (DoL) decision not to revoke land title documents issued for plots of land in Buri Ram

data.title: Prime Minister Paetongtarn advances key agendas at Apec forum
data.description: Prime Minister  Paetongtarn Shinawatra  will meet Chinese President  Xi Jinping  and other world leaders at the four-day 31st  Apec Economic Leaders

data.title: Leopard spotted in Kaeng Krachan park
data.description: A leopard was spotted wandering around a helipad in Kaeng Krachan National Park in Phetchaburi province, believed to be waiting for its prey.

data.title: Headless dugong found floating off Phuket coast
data.description: A headless dugong was found floating near a pier in Phuket on Thursday, making it the third dead dugong reported this month.

data.title: Frenchman charged for illegally possessing baby macaques
data.description: A Frenchman has been charged with illegally keeping four young macaques after sharing their photos on social media.

data.title: People's Party submits push to limit Senate's role
data.description: One of the proposals for an amendment to the constitution submitted by the People

data.title: Paetongtarn to visit Malaysia to boost ties, trade
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra will visit Malaysia next month in a bid to further strengthen ties and boost trade while also working on improving border security.

data.title: EC explains new PAO poll date
data.description: The election of chairs and members of Provincial Administrative Organisations (PAOs) will be held on Saturday, Feb 1, instead of Sunday, Feb 2, in a bid to ensure the vote runs smoothly given the legal limitations outlined in the election law, EC commissioner Santhat Siriananpaiboon says.
